author: NASS
description:
I colorized, restored, and created a sound design for this video, which offers a rare glimpse of everyday life in post-war Russia. Captured in 1948, it showcases the streets of Moscow and Leningrad filled with trams, trolleybuses, and bustling crowds, reflecting a nation rebuilding itself with resilience and pride. The film provides a vivid look at Soviet urban life during a pivotal moment in history — a fascinating window into the atmosphere of a country emerging from the aftermath of World War II.

Leningrad 00:06-06:06
Moscow 06:07-8:27

Video Restoration Process:
✔ FPS boosted to 60 frames per second 
✔ Image resolution boosted up to HD 
✔ Improved video sharpness and brightness 
✔ Colorized only for the ambiance (not historically accurate)
✔added sound only for the ambiance
✔restoration:(stabilisation,denoise,cleand,deblur) 

Please, be aware that colorization colors are not real and fake, colorization was made only for the ambiance and do not represent real historical data.

B&W
title: A Day in Russia 1940s in Color, Post-War [60fps, Remastered] w/Sound Design
